subject: Fix bad use of jsonify() in _get_data
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-30 20:40:40.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_health/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-health/commit/776c0a568377bb0fc531430eafc7ee584ed4a4ac', 'message': 'Fix bad use of jsonify() in _get_data

When no test runs are found in the subunit2sql database we attempt to
return an empty result set in get_test_runs_for_test. However, in the
cached function _get_data() the empty response was wrapped in a
call to jsonify() causing the function to return a Response rather
than a serializable dict.

This patch removes the bad jsonify() call to avoid any serialization
errors for pages with no data.

Change-Id: I49d47bb998593f61fc4b1431d366c4cdd9bb3d2c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bad use of jsonify() in _get_data

When no test runs are found in the subunit2sql database we attempt to
return an empty result set in get_test_runs_for_test. However, in the
cached function _get_data() the empty response was wrapped in a
call to jsonify() causing the function to return a Response rather
than a serializable dict.

This patch removes the bad jsonify() call to avoid any serialization
errors for pages with no data.

Change-Id: I49d47bb998593f61fc4b1431d366c4cdd9bb3d2c

commit_message:
Guard against driver error for nova validation

This patch adds exception catching when invoking the nova server driver
from the nova server profile. This is to make the profile more robust in
the face of driver exceptions.

Change-Id: Iaef518f6c321ac1ae3d6b4900585290b31012563

subject: Set default value for [saml]/idp_contact_surname
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-16 23:12:33.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/conf/saml.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/67490080db7e4d1bdcf0d0c35f401be659907f07', 'message': 'Set default value for [saml]/idp_contact_surname

The keystone federation configuration documentation[1] says that the
Contact options are "advisable" to set, but not strictly necessary.
However, without this patch, the keystone SAML IdP will generate
metadata where one of its tags is malformed:

  <ns0:SurName />

On a Shibboleth-based keystone SP, shibd will successfully start but
fail to retrieve metadata from the IdP, with the message:

  ERROR OpenSAML.MetadataProvider.XML : metadata instance failed manual validation checking: SurName must have TextContent.

Attempting to exchange the SAML assertion will then fail with a 500
error.

While it is advisable for the user to set this surname value, it should
not be strictly necessary, especially in a developer or
proof-of-concept environment. This patch gives the config option a
default value, similar to the other [saml]/idp_contact_* default values.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/keystone/configure_federation.html#configuration-options

Change-Id: I2742f6b4747f1dc5f5593afae1cfde4e494b7848
'}]
commit_message:
Set default value for [saml]/idp_contact_surname

The keystone federation configuration documentation[1] says that the
Contact options are "advisable" to set, but not strictly necessary.
However, without this patch, the keystone SAML IdP will generate
metadata where one of its tags is malformed:

  <ns0:SurName />

On a Shibboleth-based keystone SP, shibd will successfully start but
fail to retrieve metadata from the IdP, with the message:

  ERROR OpenSAML.MetadataProvider.XML : metadata instance failed manual validation checking: SurName must have TextContent.

Attempting to exchange the SAML assertion will then fail with a 500
error.

While it is advisable for the user to set this surname value, it should
not be strictly necessary, especially in a developer or
proof-of-concept environment. This patch gives the config option a
default value, similar to the other [saml]/idp_contact_* default values.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/keystone/configure_federation.html#configuration-options

Change-Id: I2742f6b4747f1dc5f5593afae1cfde4e494b7848

credential provider, it doesn't necessarily make sense because we don't expose

Change-Id: Iad04bd1340a9a59c465337dedcfcd1ea0bed4bde

commit_message:
Emit log message for fernet tokens only

A previous refactor improved some of the logging we had when loading Fernet
keys. The log message makes sense from a token perspective since
`max_active_keys` is configured for the fernet token provider. For the
credential provider, it doesn't necessarily make sense because we don't expose
a `max_active_keys` option through configuration.

This commit makes it so the we only emit the log message when it is referencing
a fernet token key repository.

Change-Id: Iad04bd1340a9a59c465337dedcfcd1ea0bed4bde

subject: Fix middleware order of proxy pipeline and add missing modules
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-30 16:18:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift/commit/28626e1046b7a6a2522cc9fa4dd4d555ab58c582', 'message': 'Fix middleware order of proxy pipeline and add missing modules

This patch fixes the order of the middlewares defined in the Swift proxy
server pipeline.

Sources for the order:
https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/etc/proxy-server.conf-sample#L91-L99
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/swift/middleware.html#
https://github.com/openstack/swift3/blob/master/etc/proxy-server.conf-sample#L9
https://github.com/openstack/ceilometermiddleware/blob/master/ceilometermiddleware/swift.py#L21-L22

These are all values in order:

 10 catch_errors
 20 gatekeeper
 30 healthcheck
 40 (reserved for proxy_logging, see below)
 50 cache
 60 container_sync
 70 swift3
 80 s3token
 90 ratelimit
100 crossdomain
110 bulk
120 tempurl
130 formpost
140 copy
150 tempauth
160 swauth
170 authtoken
180 keystone
190 staticweb
200 copy
210 account_quotas
220 container_quotas
230 slo
240 dlo
250 versioned_writes
260 ceilometer
270 proxy-logging
280 proxy-server

The copy and versioned_writes middlewares have been added too.

The proxy_logging should be added a second time at position 40, but the
actual value is 270 to have the final proxy-logging just before the
proxy-server.

Closes-Bug: 1618514
Change-Id: I99433720e32dc3557b809c8d42ce3d5981c199c3
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-31 12:04:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift/commit/ac1350b04990e9023e2b60f902161ed63206bcfb', 'message': "Fix middleware order of proxy pipeline and add missing modules

This patch fixes the order of the middlewares defined in the Swift proxy
server pipeline.

Sources for the order:
https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/etc/proxy-server.conf-sample#L91-L99
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/swift/middleware.html#
https://github.com/openstack/swift3/blob/master/etc/proxy-server.conf-sample#L9
https://github.com/openstack/ceilometermiddleware/blob/master/ceilometermiddleware/swift.py#L21-L22

These are all values in order:

 10 catch_errors
 20 gatekeeper
 30 healthcheck
 40 (reserved for proxy_logging, see below)
 50 cache
 60 container_sync
 70 swift3
 80 s3token
 90 ratelimit
100 crossdomain
110 bulk
120 tempurl
130 formpost
140 copy
150 tempauth
160 swauth
170 authtoken
180 keystone
190 staticweb
200 copy
210 account_quotas
220 container_quotas
230 slo
240 dlo
250 versioned_writes
260 ceilometer
270 proxy-logging
280 proxy-server

The copy and versioned_writes middlewares have been added too.

The proxy_logging should be added a second time at position 40, but the
actual value is 270 to have the final proxy-logging just before the
proxy-server.

commit_message:
Fix middleware order of proxy pipeline and add missing modules

This patch fixes the order of the middlewares defined in the Swift proxy
server pipeline.

Sources for the order:
https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/etc/proxy-server.conf-sample#L91-L99
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/swift/middleware.html#
https://github.com/openstack/swift3/blob/master/etc/proxy-server.conf-sample#L9
https://github.com/openstack/ceilometermiddleware/blob/master/ceilometermiddleware/swift.py#L21-L22

These are all values in order:

 10 catch_errors
 20 gatekeeper
 30 healthcheck
 40 (reserved for proxy_logging, see below)
 50 cache
 60 container_sync
 70 swift3
 80 s3token
 90 ratelimit
100 crossdomain
110 bulk
120 tempurl
130 formpost
140 copy
150 tempauth
160 swauth
170 authtoken
180 keystone
190 staticweb
200 copy
210 account_quotas
220 container_quotas
230 slo
240 dlo
250 versioned_writes
260 ceilometer
270 proxy-logging
280 proxy-server

The copy and versioned_writes middlewares have been added too.

The proxy_logging should be added a second time at position 40, but the
actual value is 270 to have the final proxy-logging just before the
proxy-server.

Also renamed the suffix 'swauth' in the 'tempauth' manifest to be
'tempauth'; 'swauth' is used in a different manifest.

Closes-Bug: 1618514
Change-Id: I99433720e32dc3557b809c8d42ce3d5981c199c3

commit_message:
Add skip logic for admin cred in test_auto_allocate_network

In case tests are being run with pre provisioned account and
admin cred are not defined then auto allocate network tests
which needs admin cred for tenant isolation should be skipped
instead of fail.

Those tests are not derived from admin base class(which is valid)
so we need to explicitly have the skip logic based on availability
of admin cred.

Change-Id: I3f0472665d7645986ee101390c8e406668a1567b

commit_message:
Update destroy include images arg to LONGOPT

Change the argument for including images as part of destroy from '-e
destroy_include_images=yes' to a more consistent --include-images.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I0a29c69121697cab751578093cc7ca58011eb853
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/83/364983/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: (--include-images to also destroy Kolla images)LONG_OPTS="help,inventory:,playbook:,tags:,key:,extra:,verbose,configdir:,passwords:,yes-i-really-really-mean-it,include-images"INCLUDE_IMAGES= (--include-images) INCLUDE_IMAGES="$1" shift 1 ;; if [[ "${INCLUDE_IMAGES}" == "--include-images" ]]; then EXTRA_OPTS="$EXTRA_OPTS -e destroy_include_images=yes" fi

commit_message:
Set Redis VIP on all nodes

Move Redis VIP from controller-only to all nodes so that we don't assume
where Redis is deployed.

Change-Id: I55f8d48e3e077951fbcc88158dd6f21a2fe5f457
Related-Bug: #1618510
Partially-Implements: blueprint custom-roles

commit_message:
Fix aodh auth url to remove suffix

puppet aodh auth type defaults to password type and v2
auth_url doesnt work with domain. This fixes the url to
not include suffix.

Change-Id: I46d53e748d8932ed1183bedbdeb5eefcde679f9e

commit_message:
Use Redis VIP when deploying with keepalived

Previously we weren't creating Redis VIP in keepalived, causing Redis to
be unusable in non-HA deployments. This is now fixed.

Depends-On: I0bb37f6fb3eed022288b2dcfc7a88e8ff88a7ace
Change-Id: I0ecfda1e6ad5567f6f58d60bf418bc91761833ab
Closes-Bug: #1618510

commit_message:
Manage Redis VIP when deploying with keepalived

Previously we weren't creating Redis VIP in keepalived, causing Redis to
be unusable in non-HA deployments.

Change-Id: I0bb37f6fb3eed022288b2dcfc7a88e8ff88a7ace
Related-Bug: #1618510

commit_message:
Fix using filter() to meet python2,3

As mentioned in link[1], if we need filter on python3,
Replace filter(lambda obj: test(obj), data) with:
[obj for obj in data if test(obj)].

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3

Change-Id: I41e56269ee4c8b1d6bd4dcb3d576d51d24b98aea
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/64/362664/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: remaining_argnames = [x for x in argnames if x not in keyed_args]
deleted_lines: remaining_argnames = filter(lambda x: x not in keyed_args, argnames)

commit_message:
Return 404 when a secret does not have a payload

Currently when a Secret payload GET is performed, a 500 Error will
be thrown if there is no payload present. The correct behavior
would be to throw a 404.

Change-Id: Ibbe8a592c853fc0196ae7c2daf365754c800fc87
Partial-Bug: #1561701
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/08/299108/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Sorry but your secret has no payload.')) try: resp = self._on_get_secret_payload( self.secret, external_project_id, **kwargs ) except exception.NotFound: _secret_payload_not_found()

commit_message:
Lazy-load outputs

Rather than passing around an explicit flag to say whether a Stack object
should parse its outputs during initialisation, just parse them the first
time they are actually needed.

Change-Id: I4b8a84883902261592fbfe8d5d5b1892702a3d03

commit_message:
Add scenario test for volume-backed scheduling/reporting

This adds a scenario for testing the behavior of volume-backed
instance scheduling and resource reporting.

Related-Bug: #1469179

Depends-On: I3f146e9d139b17d29ab981056b41e7b62f9a5592

Change-Id: I9d9deeb99e739e72511393fc0689dddb1f758704
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/96/355096/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: credentials = ['primary', 'admin'] delete_on_termination=False, flavor=None): if flavor: create_kwargs['flavor'] = flavor['id'] @test.idempotent_id('78216e12-e204-4062-87fe-a07418dc0cb8') @test.services('compute', 'volume', 'image') def test_boot_volume_larger_than_local_gb(self): """Test whether flavor root_gb is ignored for boot from volume. For instances booted from volume, the root_gb size of the flavor should not be considered for scheduling and reporting. See https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1469179 for details. """ # create flavors with disk larger than available host local disk kwargs = {'name': data_utils.rand_name('flavor'), 'ram': 64, 'vcpus': 1, 'disk': 1024} flavor = self.admin_manager.flavors_client.create_flavor( **kwargs)['flavor'] self.addCleanup(self.admin_manager.flavors_client.delete_flavor, flavor['id']) kwargs.update({'name': data_utils.rand_name('flavor'), 'disk': 2048}) flavor_alt = self.admin_manager.flavors_client.create_flavor( **kwargs)['flavor'] self.addCleanup(self.admin_manager.flavors_client.delete_flavor, flavor_alt['id']) # check the current local_gb and local_gb_used def get_hypervisor_stats(): return self.admin_manager.hypervisor_client.\ show_hypervisor_statistics()['hypervisor_statistics'] def verify_hypervisor_stats(expected, actual): self.assertEqual(expected['local_gb'], actual['local_gb']) self.assertEqual(expected['local_gb_used'], actual['local_gb_used']) # do actions that could change hypervisor reporting and verify # that none of them change local disk reporting expected_stats = get_hypervisor_stats() # boot instance from volume with flavor volume_origin = self._create_volume_from_image() instance = self._boot_instance_from_volume(volume_origin['id'], flavor=flavor) stats = get_hypervisor_stats() verify_hypervisor_stats(expected_stats, stats) # rebuild (not supported for boot from volume, it gives the # instance an image_ref which makes the virt driver think # it's not boot from volume. Also: # https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1470702 # resize self.manager.servers_client.resize_server(instance['id'], flavor_alt['id']) waiters.wait_for_server_status(self.manager.servers_client, instance['id'], 'VERIFY_RESIZE') stats = get_hypervisor_stats() verify_hypervisor_stats(expected_stats, stats) # confirm self.manager.servers_client.confirm_resize_server(instance['id']) waiters.wait_for_server_status(self.manager.servers_client, instance['id'], 'ACTIVE') stats = get_hypervisor_stats() verify_hypervisor_stats(expected_stats, stats) # shelve self.manager.servers_client.shelve_server(instance['id'], force_shelve_offload=True) waiters.wait_for_server_status(self.manager.servers_client, instance['id'], 'SHELVED_OFFLOADED') stats = get_hypervisor_stats() verify_hypervisor_stats(expected_stats, stats) # unshelve self.manager.servers_client.unshelve_server(instance['id']) waiters.wait_for_server_status(self.manager.servers_client, instance['id'], 'ACTIVE') stats = get_hypervisor_stats() verify_hypervisor_stats(expected_stats, stats) # delete self._delete_server(instance) stats = get_hypervisor_stats() verify_hypervisor_stats(expected_stats, stats)

commit_message:
add more credentials information to check_is_admin

Currently, It can specify only user_id when checking admin.
Add more information for checking admin because it is not enough
in multi-domain configuration.

Change-Id: I5e3d6b88e8286b50bc0641163fadf27199fb4a55
closes-bug: 1619597

deleted_lines: Can use roles or user_id from context to determine if user is admin. In a multi-domain configuration, roles alone may not be sufficient. # attempts to apply. Since our credentials dict does not include a # project_id, this target can never match as a generic rule. credentials = {'roles': context.roles, 'user_id': context.user_id }

commit_message:
fix systemd resource deadlock

Dependency to start network-pre (which
depends on network.target) before
dhcp-interface@.service collides with
Ubuntu's own network.target that suupose
to start after network-pre.

Change-Id: I9e59c970bfb1ebdaa15b4ec6b545761ede3ca056
Closes-bug: #1619816

commit_message:
Template validation/gating

This adds support to the tests/gate for checking if all the
templates are valid yaml. If they have alpha init-containers,
check if they are valid json.

It also fixes a few broken links in the service catalog that
the tests discovered were broken.

Change-Id: I8149f68437b4604fc79ac7f1e5a2811f9a706dfa

commit_message:
Huawei: Modify array LUNs naming rules

We use the first 8 chars in the uuid string and hash
value of uuid to name array LUNs, We can establish
the relationship between the volume uuid and the array
lun name.

There is no need to rename lun on array in unmanage and
unmanage_snapshot, So we remove the rename calls.

Change-Id: Id4cdfc3b73a4c97fa2c14aa2afb361e643ab6369
Closes-Bug: #1570205

added_lines: pre_name = name.split("-")[0] vol_encoded = str(hash(name)) if vol_encoded.startswith('-'): newuuid = pre_name + vol_encoded else: newuuid = pre_name + '-' + vol_encoded
deleted_lines: import base64import uuid uuid_str = name.replace("-", "") vol_uuid = uuid.UUID('urn:uuid:%s' % uuid_str) vol_encoded = base64.urlsafe_b64encode(vol_uuid.bytes) vol_encoded = vol_encoded.decode("utf-8") # Make it compatible to py3. newuuid = vol_encoded.replace("=", "")

commit_message:
Add configuration for lbaas certificates

Added configuration for lbaas certificates configuration. The options
to configure the certificate managgement type and the storage path
for the lbaas certificates has been added in this change.

Change-Id: Ifa5604f6bd8c8110722450460f887a1982e6c03d
(cherry picked from commit 258f7f25294429f939089b19b33f5ddc07cf9240)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/64/366164/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*cert_manager_type*] # (optional) Certificate manager type to use for lbaas. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # Example: barbican # # [*cert_storage_path*] # (optional) The location to store certificates locally. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # Example: /var/lib/neutron-lbaas/certificates/ # # [*barbican_auth*] # (optional) Name of the barbican authentication method to use. # Defaults to $::os_service_default # Example: barbican_acl_auth # $cert_manager_type = $::os_service_default, $cert_storage_path = $::os_service_default, $barbican_auth = $::os_service_default, neutron_config { 'certificates/cert_manager_type': value => $cert_manager_type; 'certificates/storage_path': value => $cert_storage_path; 'certificates/barbican_auth': value => $barbican_auth; }

commit_message:
Modify use of assertTrue(A in B)

Developers should use assertIn(A, B) instead of assertTrue(A in B ).

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Iae5f990574a4198178de238138731df90d27063b

subject: Fix nginx SCRIPT_NAME uwsgi_param
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-05 15:26:46.000000000', 'files': ['templates/keystone_nginx.conf.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone/commit/42cef50e5f017b9b1964eb75639557b1afdf4c4a', 'message': 'Fix nginx SCRIPT_NAME uwsgi_param

The SCRIPT_NAME uwsgi_param is passed to the client resulting in errors
such as:

UnknownConnectionError: Unexpected exception for
http://10.1.1.101:5000keystone-wsgi-public/v3/auth/tokens:
Failed to parse: 10.1.1.101:5000keystone-wsgi-public

We should default this to a blank string to ensure this works
appropriately.

Change-Id: I3da36f8e2281eefdbad903d438ffd93ddd2f5071
'}]
commit_message:
Fix nginx SCRIPT_NAME uwsgi_param

The SCRIPT_NAME uwsgi_param is passed to the client resulting in errors
such as:

UnknownConnectionError: Unexpected exception for
http://10.1.1.101:5000keystone-wsgi-public/v3/auth/tokens:
Failed to parse: 10.1.1.101:5000keystone-wsgi-public

We should default this to a blank string to ensure this works
appropriately.

Change-Id: I3da36f8e2281eefdbad903d438ffd93ddd2f5071
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone refs/changes/08/365708/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: uwsgi_param SCRIPT_NAME '';

commit_message:
L2 Agent Extensions handle unimplemented methods

If an L2 agent extension does not implement the handle_port or delete_port
methods, we should check for that using hasattr() beforehand rather than
catching any AttributeErrors.  This is based on a conversation related to
identical code in the L3 agent extensions:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/339246/15/neutron/agent/l3/l3_agent_extensions_manager.py@44

commit_message:
Do not send shared param when not allowed.

When a user changes the name of a network,
neutron returns a 403 error.
Even if the user only changes the name and doesn't
change the shared state, Horizon send
the shared data to neutron and neutron returns
 403 when the user doesn't have admin rights

Change-Id: I52726b7215acb877f38069c95d190eb36399954f
Closes-Bug: #1609467
(cherry picked from commit 28c443f4e320c4c35b650f0aedb1e6343c785be3)

commit_message:
Fix error detection in horizon test suite

Also, simplify tox environment by reducing repeated definition of the same
test command across all of the "test suite" environments.

Change-Id: Icbe7558b973dcd1ef50c85cdefc02e165b5bdc7c
Closes-Bug: 1620430
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/12/365812/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Try to detect whether a limited test suite is being specified and if so # direct the testing to that suite's project; otherwise run the full suite # in both horizon and openstack_dashboard "projects". EXIT_STATUS=0; \ {envpython} {toxinidir}/manage.py test horizon --settings=horizon.test.settings {posargs} || EXIT_STATUS=$?; \ {envpython} {toxinidir}/manage.py test openstack_dashboard --settings=openstack_dashboard.test.settings --exclude-dir=openstack_dashboard/test/integration_tests {posargs} || EXIT_STATUS=$?; \ exit $EXIT_STATUS; \
deleted_lines: [testenv:py27] {envpython} {toxinidir}/manage.py test horizon --settings=horizon.test.settings {posargs}; \ {envpython} {toxinidir}/manage.py test openstack_dashboard --settings=openstack_dashboard.test.settings --exclude-dir=openstack_dashboard/test/integration_tests {posargs}; \whitelist_externals = bash commands = bash -c 'project=`echo {posargs} | cut -d. -f1`; \ if [ -z "$project" ]; then \ {envpython} {toxinidir}/manage.py test horizon --settings=horizon.test.settings {posargs}; \ {envpython} {toxinidir}/manage.py test openstack_dashboard --settings=openstack_dashboard.test.settings --exclude-dir=openstack_dashboard/test/integration_tests {posargs}; \ else \ {envpython} {toxinidir}/manage.py test {posargs} --settings=$project.test.settings --exclude-dir=openstack_dashboard/test/integration_tests; \ fi'

commit_message:
Move Murano CFAPI configuration to separate config files

Since [1] CFAPI configuration is in separate config files:
as for main service configuration (murano-cfapi.conf) as for paste ini
configuration (murano-cfapi-paste.ini).

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/murano/+spec/separate-service-broker-from-murano

Change-Id: I3e12452680e85c88adf45c68605d13d00932c020

commit_message:
keystone: configure credentials

Configure Keystone on the undercloud to generate credentials during
bootstrap.

This step is required with latest Keystone. Puppet will take care of
running keystone-manage credential_setup one time but won't do any
rotation or any export of the key yet.

Change-Id: I5439c634be8335884e395cde3f4d036524e10abb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/40/366240/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: keystone::enable_credential_setup: true

commit_message:
Ensure that repo build arch grouping always runs

The initial repo build task must always run, otherwise it will
cause failures when trying to use tags when executing the repo
build.

Change-Id: I5e057f5843c65320c9d3f6f14f6414d504997b61

commit_message:
Improve unit test coverage for cmd/db_manage.py

Add new unit tests for cmd/db_manage.py.
Increase the coverage for cmd/db_manage.py from 0 to 100%.

Move the subcommand 'command' of db_manage to out side
of method main for easier testing.

Change-Id: I686fbc25fd58aea91b5a862fc61c832f4e0d8684
Partial-Bug: #1511667
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/64/354564/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 - Fujitsu, Ltd. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import mock import six from magnum.cmd import db_manage from magnum.tests import base class TestMagnumDbManage(base.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestMagnumDbManage, self).setUp() def clear_conf(): db_manage.CONF.reset() db_manage.CONF.unregister_opt(db_manage.command_opt) clear_conf() self.addCleanup(clear_conf) @mock.patch('magnum.db.migration.version') @mock.patch('sys.argv', ['magnum-db-manage', 'version']) def test_db_manage_version(self, mock_version): with mock.patch('sys.stdout', new=six.StringIO()) as fakeOutput: mock_version.return_value = '123456' db_manage.main() self.assertEqual('Current DB revision is 123456\n', fakeOutput.getvalue()) mock_version.assert_called_once_with() @mock.patch('magnum.db.migration.upgrade') @mock.patch('sys.argv', ['magnum-db-manage', 'upgrade']) def test_db_manage_upgrade(self, mock_upgrade): db_manage.main() mock_upgrade.assert_called_once_with(base.CONF.command.revision) @mock.patch('magnum.db.migration.stamp') @mock.patch('sys.argv', ['magnum-db-manage', 'stamp', 'foo bar']) def test_db_manage_stamp(self, mock_stamp): db_manage.main() mock_stamp.assert_called_once_with('foo bar') @mock.patch('magnum.db.migration.revision') @mock.patch('sys.argv', ['magnum-db-manage', 'revision', '-m', 'foo bar']) def test_db_manage_revision(self, mock_revision): db_manage.main() mock_revision.assert_called_once_with( message='foo bar', autogenerate=base.CONF.command.autogenerate)

commit_message:
Make magnum manage_template read config file and increase coverage

Currently magnum-manage-template command doesn't read config file
properly. This patch make manage-template script read config file
and display template list the right way.

Add new unit tests for cmd/template_manage.py.
Increase the coverage for cmd/template_manage.py from 0 to 100%.

Change-Id: I3a4df33834201148f824ebe013c5a22aee3ec1f8
Partial-Bug: #1511667
Closes-Bug: #1612596

added_lines: # Copyright 2016 - Fujitsu, Ltd. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. import mock from magnum.cmd import template_manage from magnum.tests import base class TestMagnumTemplateManage(base.TestCase): @mock.patch.object(template_manage.TemplateManager, 'run') @mock.patch('sys.argv', ['foo', 'bar']) def test_none_arg(self, mock_run): args = None template_manage.main(args) mock_run.assert_called_once_with(['bar']) # NOTE(hieulq): we fake the entrypoints then we need to mock the cliff # produce_output in order to assert with fake value @mock.patch('magnum.cmd.template_manage.TemplateList.produce_output') @mock.patch('magnum.drivers.common.template_def.TemplateDefinition') def test_correct_arg_with_details_and_path(self, mock_tdef, mock_produce): args = ['list-templates', '-d', '-p'] # Fake the entrypoints fake_entry = mock.MagicMock() fake_entry.name = 'fake_name' fake_cls = mock.MagicMock() fake_definition = fake_cls() fake_definition.provides = [{'coe': 'foo', 'os': 'bar', 'server_type': 'test'}] fake_definition.template_path = 'fake_path' def _fake_entry(): yield fake_entry, fake_cls mock_tdef.load_entry_points.side_effect = _fake_entry template_manage.main(args) mock_tdef.load_entry_points.assert_called_once_with() mock_produce.assert_called_once_with(mock.ANY, mock.ANY, [('fake_name', False, 'test', 'bar', 'foo', 'fake_path')]) # NOTE(hieulq): we fake the entrypoints then we need to mock the cliff # produce_output in order to assert with fake value @mock.patch('magnum.cmd.template_manage.TemplateList.produce_output') @mock.patch('magnum.drivers.common.template_def.TemplateDefinition') def test_correct_arg_without_details_and_path(self, mock_tdef, mock_produce): args = ['list-templates'] # Fake the entrypoints fake_entry = mock.MagicMock() fake_entry.name = 'fake_name' fake_cls = mock.MagicMock() def _fake_entry(): yield fake_entry, fake_cls mock_tdef.load_entry_points.side_effect = _fake_entry template_manage.main(args) mock_tdef.load_entry_points.assert_called_once_with() mock_produce.assert_called_once_with(mock.ANY, mock.ANY, [('fake_name', False)]) # NOTE(hieulq): we fake the entrypoints then we need to mock the cliff # produce_output in order to assert with fake value @mock.patch('magnum.cmd.template_manage.TemplateList.produce_output') @mock.patch('magnum.drivers.common.template_def.TemplateDefinition') def test_correct_arg_with_enabled_template(self, mock_tdef, mock_produce): args = ['list-templates', '--enabled'] self.config(enabled_definitions={'magnum_test_foo_bar'}, group='bay') # Fake the entrypoints fake_entry1 = mock.MagicMock() fake_entry1.name = 'magnum_test_foo_bar' fake_cls1 = mock.MagicMock() fake_entry2 = mock.MagicMock() fake_entry2.name = 'magnum_test_bar_foo' fake_cls2 = mock.MagicMock() def _fake_entry(): yield fake_entry1, fake_cls1 yield fake_entry2, fake_cls2 mock_tdef.load_entry_points.side_effect = _fake_entry template_manage.main(args) mock_tdef.load_entry_points.assert_called_once_with() mock_produce.assert_called_once_with(mock.ANY, mock.ANY, [('magnum_test_foo_bar', True)])

commit_message:
Add timestamp fields for neutron ext resources

Propose a new extension named "timestamp_ext" to add timestamp to
neutron ext resources like router/floatingip/security_group/security_group_rule.

APIImpact
DocImpact: Neutron ext resources now contain 'timestamp' fields like
           'created_at' and 'updated_at'
Implements: blueprint add-neutron-extension-resource-timestamp

Change-Id: I78b00516e31ce83376d37f57299b2229b6fb8fcf

commit_message:
Revert "Force image-type qcow2 for OVH"

We are having some image upload issues with OVH, so we are reverting
to make sure qcow2 is not the issue.

This reverts commit 59c8db73a7afb14a339ab318804c056923cb0eb3.

Change-Id: If5ab0e637886dc959ede263e83e8ed0f9f8ca9b0
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: Revert "Revert "Pre-install pip/virtualenv packages""
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-14 03:56:51.000000000', 'files': ['elements/centos-minimal/environment.d/10-centos-distro-name.bash', 'elements/pip-and-virtualenv/install.d/pip-and-virtualenv-source-install/01-install-pip'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/995c539491c72ab338a443099fcf66fb28a4e58b', 'message': 'Revert "Revert "Pre-install pip/virtualenv packages""

This reverts commit a645fa4ffb3c819f38ce1c66e83eb409c587c55d.

It is really devstack causing problems here; it was removing the
python-virtualenv package & re-installing using pip (see depends-on).
This failed because the pip-install we did here removed the egg-file
that rpm expected to be there, so rpm bailed out on the removal.

But even if it worked, this just leads you back down the path of the
original problem; that the system packaged version can be re-installed
and overwrites the pip installed version.  Thus I still believe this
is the correct thing to do in the dib element.

Note it is not a common problem (devstack aside); most jobs don't
touch python-virtualenv & related packages (the one we did notice this
on was being brought over from travisci where it was required for some
reason).

Change-Id: I82acb865378a0fa5903a6267bfcee0e2962eced0
Depends-On: Ib0edf6c4ee8a510e9d671213de35d787f56acfed
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Pre-install pip/virtualenv packages""

This reverts commit a645fa4ffb3c819f38ce1c66e83eb409c587c55d.

It is really devstack causing problems here; it was removing the
python-virtualenv package & re-installing using pip (see depends-on).
This failed because the pip-install we did here removed the egg-file
that rpm expected to be there, so rpm bailed out on the removal.

But even if it worked, this just leads you back down the path of the
original problem; that the system packaged version can be re-installed
and overwrites the pip installed version.  Thus I still believe this
is the correct thing to do in the dib element.

Note it is not a common problem (devstack aside); most jobs don't
touch python-virtualenv & related packages (the one we did notice this
on was being brought over from travisci where it was required for some
reason).

Change-Id: I82acb865378a0fa5903a6267bfcee0e2962eced0
Depends-On: Ib0edf6c4ee8a510e9d671213de35d787f56acfed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/34/341934/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ $DISTRO_NAME =~ (centos|fedora) ]]; then # GENERAL WARNING : mixing packaged python libraries with # pip-installed versions always creates issues. Upstream # openstack-infra uses this a lot (especially devstack) but be # warned: here be dragons :) # Firstly we want to install the system packages. Otherwise later # on somebody does a "yum install python-virtualenv" and goes and # overwrites the pip installed version with the packaged version, # leading to all sorts of weird version issues. ${YUM:-yum} install -y python-virtualenv python-pip python-setuptools # install pip; this overwrites packaged pip python /tmp/get-pip.py # pip and setuptools are closely related; we want to ensure the # latest for sanity. Because distro packages don't include enough # info in the egg for pip to be certain it has fully uninstalled # the old package, for safety we clear it out by hand (this seems # to have been a problem with very old to new updates, # e.g. centos6 to current-era, but less so for smaller jumps). # There is a bit of chicken-and-egg problem with pip in that it # requires setuptools for some operations, such as wheel creation. # But just installing setuptools shouldn't require setuptools # itself, so we are safe for this small section. rm -rf /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/setuptools* pip install -U setuptools # now install latest virtualenv. it vendors stuff it needs so # doesn't have issues with other system packages. pip install -U virtualenv # Add this to exclude so that we don't install a later package # over it if it updates. Note that fedora-minimal, bootstrapped # via yum, can have an old yum.conf around, so look for dnf first. if [[ -f /etc/dnf/dnf.conf ]]; then conf=/etc/dnf/dnf.conf elif [[ -f /etc/yum.conf ]]; then conf=/etc/yum.conf else die "No conf to modify?" fi echo "exclude=python-virtualenv,python-pip,python-setuptools" >> ${conf} else python /tmp/get-pip.py pip install virtualenv fi

from k8s fedora and swarm driver and put at the common location
to avoid duplicacy and redundancy of code.

subject: Remove the PVID Looper
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-18 14:05:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-powervm/commit/f6326af8fcf6f97f6c3d9f9579e3beb6c11a75da', 'message': 'DNM: Remove the PVID Looper

With the ability to pass the VLAN over to nova, via the mechanism driver
and vif binding details, we no longer need the PVID Updater.

Previously the function would wait for nova to provision a VIF on VLAN
1.  Then the sea networking agent would detect this new port, update the
SEA to support the VLAN (if needed) and then update the VLAN on the VIF.

Now that we can pass the VLAN to Nova at the VIF create time, that last

commit_message:
Remove the PVID Looper

With the ability to pass the VLAN over to nova, via the mechanism driver
and vif binding details, we no longer need the PVID Updater.

Previously the function would wait for nova to provision a VIF on VLAN
1.  Then the sea networking agent would detect this new port, update the
SEA to support the VLAN (if needed) and then update the VLAN on the VIF.

Now that we can pass the VLAN to Nova at the VIF create time, that last
step is not needed.

Change-Id: Ifc5bfe8b5e118f02faf0556cc3e67d11a66e2b25

commit_message:
Use default region_name parameter in clients

As part of I289c7f8dc93a30ba1d5aa06d9da29a6af1308b9a clients
gained knowledge of region they're using, however there were a couple
of typos in initialising those.

This commit alters:
heat client to use region passed
mistral client to have default value (None)

Change-Id: I925c41b09758f531ebf021381f4899fb537b6f32
Closes-Bug: #1620716

commit_message:
Migrate FWaaS policy.json to FWaaS repo

This change migrates the FWaaS policy.json entries from the Neutron
policy.json, and into the FWaaS repository.  It also adds entries for
FWaaS v2.

Change-Id: Idd8993da78dbd779e2b3d38a4039dabf60d416d5

added_lines: --- features: - Add flannel's host-gw backend option. Magnum deploys cluster over a dedicated neutron private network by using flannel. Flannel's host-gw backend gives the best performance in this topopolgy (private layer2) since there is no packet processing overhead, no reduction to MTU, scales to many hosts as well as the alternatives. The label "flannel_use_vxlan" was repurposed when the network driver is flannel. 1. Rename the label flannel_use_vxlan to flannel_backend. 2. Redefine the value of this label from "yes/no" to "udp/vxlan/host-gw".

commit_message:
Use werkzeug to run Magnum API with SSL

wsgiref.simple_server is mono threaded process that can not
support SSL context. This patch aim to replace wsgiref.simple_server
with werkzeug for running development API server supporting SSL.

Change-Id: Ib4360d77030e4cce8abf5ea543d87b7982e0e285
Closes-Bug: #1614596

subject: Change NeutronWorkers default to result in previous behavior
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-01 17:57:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/4df0a6015356c4bbce57f7a5d4afecd031f26d00', 'message': "Change NeutronWorkerCount default to result in previous behavior

Neutron's behavior changed in Newton with respect to a configured
api_workers of 0, resulting in controllers with only one worker process
for handling API request where previously it was effectively the same as
processorcount. This change alters the default value  to regain the
previous behavior.

This change also extends the worker count to the RPC worker setting -
which was possibly an oversight in previous releases. The default
behavior will have no result.

Closes-Bug: 1619383

Change-Id: Id6e3ee544160372c806905e77348150a1a1eec1b

commit_message:
Change NeutronWorkers default to result in previous behavior

Neutron's behavior changed in Newton with respect to the default value
of 0 for NeutronWorkers. Instead of effectively treating it as
"processorcount", it now assumes we mean what we say and doesn't spawn
any workers, resulting in only a single process for handling API
requests. This change alters the default value to regain the previous
behavior.

This change also extends the worker count to the RPC worker setting -
which was possibly an oversight in previous releases. The default
behavior will have no result for most systems.

Closes-Bug: 1619383

Change-Id: Id6e3ee544160372c806905e77348150a1a1eec1b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/83/364483/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: default: '' description: | Sets the number of API and RPC workers for the Neutron service. The default value results in the configuration being left unset and a system-dependent default will be chosen (usually the number of processors). Please note that this can result in a large number of processes and memory consumption on systems with a large core count. On such systems it is recommended that a non-default value be selected that matches the load requirements. type: string neutron::server::rpc_workers: {get_param: NeutronWorkers}
deleted_lines: default: 0 description: Number of workers for Neutron service. type: number

commit_message:
Only cache callables in the base manager

The base manager had an issue where if a property was accessed through the
__getattr__ it would be cached.

Closes-Bug: 1620722
Change-Id: Iad7ca87a30fd5fa9f8bc88a0c7f74acca2ae1a56

commit_message:
Remove self.__dict__ for formatting strings

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#dictionaries-lists
It is not clear as using explicit dictionaries
and help avoid some errors during refactoring.

Change-Id: Iac567648435cd83c3d3fafc1a3e69ea75f2b1624

commit_message:
Add Python 3.5 classifier and venv for anchor

Now that there is a passing gate job, we can claim support for
Python 3.5 in the classifier. This patch also adds the
convenience py35 venv.

commit_message:
Add 'library convergence' to Requirements mission

The current Requirements team mission is failing to mention an
important aspect of the team job, which is to try to get the
dependencies to converge toward the best-maintained library where
there are multiple variants used to get the same functionality.

Change-Id: I987bb346c666e41825dccc9b17eed42920d59361
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/02/363502/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Coordinating and converging the libraries used by OpenStack projects, while ensuring that all libraries are compatible both technically and from a licensing standpoint.
deleted_lines: Coordinating the libraries used by OpenStack projects ensuring that all libraries are compatible both technically and from a licensing standpoint.

commit_message:
Move pip_lock_to_internal_repo to group_vars

The pip_lock_to_internal_repo variable is repeated in most playbooks,
move it to all's group vars instead.

The repo_all group and lxc_hosts play are exceptions, overriding it to
False.

Change-Id: I65393b74ed00d3348424e06f4f2fd4b4687cb8d6

commit_message:
keystone/credential: use osfamily

Use osfamily to configure Keystone credentials, so our users deploying
on RHEL or Fedora can also run p-o-i.

Change-Id: I80ca149b7295db8d6c37d52ec0dadb5af0da30be

commit_message:
Resolve tasks by node tags

A 'tags' attribute has been added to each role in 'roles_metadata'.
Initially all non-controller roles will only have a tag of their own
role name. This will allow existing tasks which do not have tags
associated with them to work correctly. In the abscence of tags a
task's roles will be used to determine which nodes it will run on.

Implements: blueprint role-decomposition

Change-Id: I79d7ecced68e8a4cb5cafe6b4815d62ae0fe5f03

commit_message:
Use more specific asserts in tests

Instead of assertTrue and assertFalse use more specific asserts.
They are compatible with Python 2.7[1] and 3.4[2]

[1]: https://docs.python.org/2.7/library/unittest.html
[2]: https://docs.python.org/3.4/library/unittest.html

Change-Id: Ic0346a9b4c254b493d7c0775f77cfa43b6c84f99
Co-Authored-By: Bin Zhou <zhou.bin9@zte.com.cn>

commit_message:
Add delete method for gnocchi to delete batch of resources

Add a method post_delete in gnocchi/rest/__init__.py to
accept an resource id list that contains ids to be deleted.
Add method delete_resources in gnocchi/indexer/sqlalchemy.py
to delete related data in db.
The HTTP request looks like:

    DELETE /v1/resource/<resource_type>
    Content-Type: application/json

        {"ids" [xx_id,xx_id...]}.

An corresponding gnocchi client CLI needs to be added later.

Change-Id: I6c2fbc7066dd45c974f2746ee1e555cd962cbb56
Partial-Bug: #1585262

commit_message:
Release Trove/Mitaka 5.1.1

This includes a fix for bug 1609915 which addresses a problem with
injection of guest configuration.

Change-Id: Ic0eb36d1691facee1e581c8fd2ec577cd06fcef5

Fix exceptions error for image plugin

and unit test added.

subject: dvr_snat: properly track SNAT traffic
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-06 19:09:41.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/dvr_snat_ns.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/ca01019ba2bb25737ddf2204e3903732dc44373e', 'message': 'dvr_snat: properly track SNAT traffic

When running DVR, it's possible for traffic to get confused and sent
through SNAT thanks to the way conntrack tracks "new" connections.  This
patch sets "nf_connctrack_tcp_loose" inside the SNAT namespace to more
intelligently handle SNAT traffic (and ignore what should be FIP
traffic).

Change-Id: If962e74313cd81ac00604dfc66727e553efe272f
'}]
commit_message:
dvr_snat: properly track SNAT traffic

When running DVR, it's possible for traffic to get confused and sent
through SNAT thanks to the way conntrack tracks "new" connections.  This
patch sets "nf_connctrack_tcp_loose" inside the SNAT namespace to more
intelligently handle SNAT traffic (and ignore what should be FIP
traffic).

Change-Id: If962e74313cd81ac00604dfc66727e553efe272f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/95/366295/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def create(self): """Create network namespace for SNAT traffic""" LOG.debug("DVR: add snat namespace: %s", self.name) ip_wrapper_root = ip_lib.IPWrapper() ip_wrapper = ip_wrapper.ensure_namespace(self.name) # Set nf_conntrack_tcp_loose to 0 to ensure mid-stream # TCP conversations aren't taken over by SNAT ip_wrapper.netns.execute(['sysctl', '-w', 'net.netfilter.nf_conntrack_tcp_loose=0'], log_fail_as_error=False, run_as_root=True)

* Fix networking so that we can extend it for MR swift gate.
* Add a vars file for region A and region B.
* Add host_vars and inventory files for region A and region B
* Split out the function-test to allow all scenarios to use the same
test.yml file.
* Use -e @vars-file.yml format in tox.ini since we can't include vars
files based on a variable.
* Remove any references to include_vars: test-vars.yml as a result of
moving to use -e @vars-file.yml

commit_message:
Add Multi Region Swift gate scenario

* Fix networking so that we can extend it for MR swift gate.
* Add a vars file for region A and region B.
* Add host_vars and inventory files for region A and region B
* Split out the function-test to allow all scenarios to use the same
test.yml file.
* Use -e @vars-file.yml format in tox.ini since we can't include vars
files based on a variable.
* Remove any references to include_vars: test-vars.yml as a result of
moving to use -e @vars-file.yml
* Add static routes into host_vars for swift-proxy and swift-storage
hosts so that they can route to the other region.
* Make addresses in test-vars more generic based on inventory.

Change-Id: I52b4068acbc80dcb7710d388ccbed2edcb8bfd61

commit_message:
Deprecate LBaaS v1 dashboard

LBaaS v1 feature has been removed from neutron(-lbaas) recently.
Horizon keeps LBaaS v1 dahsboard for backward compatibilty in
Newton release and will remove it in the next release.

Change-Id: Ie97acbdde234dca14a586a434b59e74be869dbd2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/38/361338/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- deprecations: - LBaaS v1 dashboard is now deprecated and will be removed in Ocata release. LBaaS v1 feature was removed from neutron-lbaas in Ocata and this functionality in Horizon is only for backward compatibility so that operators can upgrade Horizon first. Note that the Dashboard support for LBaaS v2 is provided as a Horizon plugin via `neutron-lbaas-dashboard project <http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/neutron-lbaas-dashboard/>`__.

commit_message:
Add test_valid_api_version in the test_constraints

There is a valid_api_version function in the constraints,but it has no
tests in the test_constraints. Therefore, I add test_valid_api_version.

Change-Id: Ic8dbe9c00f762513ec9a4ffc0b77e4e5d3e5d47b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/47/365847/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_valid_api_version(self): version = 'v1' self.assertTrue(constraints.valid_api_version(version)) version = 'v1.0' self.assertTrue(constraints.valid_api_version(version)) version = 'v2' self.assertFalse(constraints.valid_api_version(version))

Fix CapacityWeiger to accept None volume type

When fixing CapacityFilter in Icfc6ba5f47c3a61b49cbec5110ef7df05eb47195

This commit fixes that and (finally):

commit_message:
Updated to use the openstack-ansible-tests repo

This change moves the role run and pre-steps to the tests
repo.

Depends-On: Ib2ec8840966aea574fef7387cee2ffabd597b4cb
Change-Id: Ib27bc814b14e3584450423d6a7f0e6842fd3fd98
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts refs/changes/30/360130/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Get package from git git: repo: "https://git.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests" dest: "/tmp/openstack-ansible-tests" clone: "yes" update: "yes" version: "master" force: yes accept_hostkey: yes register: git_clone until: git_clone|success retries: 5 delay: 2 - include: "/tmp/openstack-ansible-tests/test-install-hostmachines.yml" tasks:
deleted_lines: - name: First ensure apt cache is always refreshed apt: update_cache: yes when: - ansible_pkg_mgr == 'apt' roles: - role: "{{ rolename | basename }}" global_environment_variables: PATH: "/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin" post_tasks:

commit_message:
Add constraint to prohibit balance-tcp from BondInterfaceOvsOptions

This patch adds an allowed_pattern contraint that uses a negative
lookahead assertion to only allow options strings that do not contain
the 'balance-tcp' option.

Change-Id: Icf8874e4e585f9a42d38091f8b38c3685f403cf1
Partial-Bug: #1612786
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/73/355073/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: heat_template_version: 2016-10-14 constraints: - allowed_pattern: "^((?!balance.tcp).)*$" description: > The balance-tcp bond mode is known to cause packet loss so this constraint will cause an error if the balance-tcp substring occurs in the options.

commit_message:
Check if volume type encryption is enabled before retrieving the data

Change-Id: I4338acf0f22e6639e29a3d2d4e589bdef8a0c10c
Closes-bug: #1593890
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/80/331380/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from openstack_dashboard import policy encryption_allowed = policy.check( (("volume", "volume_extension:volume_type_encryption"),), self.request) if encryption_allowed: # Gather volume type encryption information try: vol_type_enc_list = cinder.volume_encryption_type_list( self.request) except Exception: vol_type_enc_list = [] msg = _( 'Unable to retrieve volume type encryption information.') exceptions.handle(self.request, msg) vol_type_enc_dict = OrderedDict([(e.volume_type_id, e) for e in vol_type_enc_list]) for volume_type in volume_types: vol_type_enc = vol_type_enc_dict.get(volume_type.id, None) if vol_type_enc is not None: volume_type.encryption = vol_type_enc volume_type.encryption.name = volume_type.name else: volume_type.encryption = None
deleted_lines: # Gather volume type encryption information try: vol_type_enc_list = cinder.volume_encryption_type_list( self.request) except Exception: vol_type_enc_list = [] msg = _('Unable to retrieve volume type encryption information.') exceptions.handle(self.request, msg) vol_type_enc_dict = OrderedDict([(e.volume_type_id, e) for e in vol_type_enc_list]) for volume_type in volume_types: vol_type_enc = vol_type_enc_dict.get(volume_type.id, None) if vol_type_enc is not None: volume_type.encryption = vol_type_enc volume_type.encryption.name = volume_type.name else: volume_type.encryption = None

commit_message:
Add support for Guru Meditation Reports for VPNaaS agents

Added oslo.reports dependency since now we explicitly require it.

Change-Id: I57ebb5acc487517b5c475d6e55a839d83bc2b37b
Implements: blueprint guru-meditation-report
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-vpnaas refs/changes/01/287801/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import logging as sys_logging from oslo_reports import guru_meditation_report as gmr from neutron_vpnaas import version # During the call to gmr.TextGuruMeditation.setup_autorun(), Guru Meditation # Report tries to start logging. Set a handler here to accommodate this. logger = sys_logging.getLogger(None) if not logger.handlers: logger.addHandler(sys_logging.StreamHandler()) _version_string = version.version_info.release_string() gmr.TextGuruMeditation.setup_autorun(version=_version_string)

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

This patch set modifies lines which are importing objects
instead of modules. As per openstack import guide lines, user should
import modules in a file not objects.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

Change-Id: Icfd86bfff12889e76316da6788db4f7f0c352275

subject: Add rexray volume driver to Swarm
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-01 14:49:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/commit/71641a9ec27d11b2de38308f5e5beb5bc85dbdc3', 'message': '[WIP][PoC] Add rexray volume driver to Swarm

Run rexray in a container on Docker Swarm using a
docker image from fedora with dmidecode and rexray
0.3.3.

TODO:
* Remove dependency on [1]
* Start rexray automatically

To use it, create a bay login to the master node and
do:
systemctl start rexray
Then do:
docker volume create --driver rexray --opt size=5 --name hellopersistence

In volume-service.sh it is checked if rexray already exists in
the image, so if you have built an image with rexray it will
just start the rexray service.

[1] https://hub.docker.com/r/strigazi/docker-rexray/

Change-Id: I11043d5edcf73a87220c86320f9938b9347c118f
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-01 14:51:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/commit/6d7c9b8d9f3dcabb6f0d1d182db473322702b336', 'message': '[WIP][PoC] Add rexray volume driver to Swarm

Run rexray in a container on Docker Swarm using a
docker image from fedora with dmidecode and rexray
0.3.3.

This change replaces change:
Ie5e78e6b9d06fd2c92915b8635b8062c008e9696

TODO:
* Remove dependency on [1]
* Start rexray automatically

To use it, create a bay login to the master node and
do:
systemctl start rexray
Then do:
docker volume create --driver rexray --opt size=5 --name hellopersistence

In volume-service.sh it is checked if rexray already exists in
the image, so if you have built an image with rexray it will
just start the rexray service.

[1] https://hub.docker.com/r/strigazi/docker-rexray/

  users in the same tenant could access the node and
  see the credentials.

Then do:
docker volume create --driver rexray --opt size=5 --name hellopersistence

In volume-service.sh it is checked if rexray already exists in
the image, so if you have built an image with rexray it will
just start the rexray service.

commit_message:
Add rexray volume driver to Swarm

* Volumes are created using the bay's trusstee user
  scoped by the bay's trustID.
* In volume-service.sh it is checked if rexray exists
  in the image, so if you have built an image with
  rexray it will configure and start rexray service.

This change replaces:
Ie5e78e6b9d06fd2c92915b8635b8062c008e9696

Change-Id: I11043d5edcf73a87220c86320f9938b9347c118f
Partially-Implements: blueprint magnum-integrate-with-cinder

commit_message:
Add missing reference to ExternalPort for DVR

Neutron DVR requires the OS::TripleO::Compute::Ports::ExternalPort to be
set to a valid port on the external network.

Change-Id: I46b96dba3e264e0e79f7f0cea83b0f66775d6d2a
Closes-Bug: 1618611
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/88/363188/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # DVR requires a port on the external network for each compute node. # This will usually match the one currently in use for # OS::TripleO::Controller::Ports::ExternalPort. # Please review your network configuration before deploying to ensure that # this is appropriate. OS::TripleO::Compute::Ports::ExternalPort: OS::TripleO::Controller::Ports::ExternalPort

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary open call and related vars in unit tests

Since the methods touching exisiting file is mocked, we don't have to
open the file. (if it is needed, we should close at first anyway)

And cleanup unecessary vars/imports that is used for making the file
path.

This patch is a followup on:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/350471/

Change-Id: I8fbc0b5b9a01782b6da5a7dd674f52d4b566ca5c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/15/351515/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: lock_parent_directory)
deleted_lines: storage_directory, lock_parent_directory) mkdirs(os.path.join(self.testdir, 'sda1', 'containers', 'p', 'a', 'a')) db_file = os.path.join(self.testdir, 'sda1', storage_directory('containers', 'p', 'a'), 'a' + '.db') open(db_file, 'w') mkdirs(os.path.join(self.testdir, 'sda1', 'containers', 'p', 'a', 'a')) db_file = os.path.join(self.testdir, 'sda1', storage_directory('containers', 'p', 'a'), 'a' + '.db') open(db_file, 'w')

commit_message:
Allow configuration of rabbitmq plugins

The rabbitmq_plugins variable was mentioned as a loop item but was not
actually being used within the task to enable the management plugin.

It can now be overridden to enable or disable any RabbitMQ plugins.

Change-Id: I35f82427be464c811ee098ef676825aaa1e05d8d
Related-Bug: 1617431
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server refs/changes/52/366252/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Configure rabbitmq plugins rabbitmq_plugins: - name: rabbitmq_management
deleted_lines: # Enable the management plugin in rabbitmq rabbitmq_plugins: - names: rabbitmq_management

commit_message:
Create glare client in functional tests

Targets bp: murano-glare-devstack-testing

added_lines: from muranoclient.glance import client as glare_client packages_service = os.environ.get("PACKAGES_SERVICE") if packages_service == "glare": glare_endpoint = "http://127.0.0.1:9494" artifacts_client = glare_client.Client( endpoint=glare_endpoint, token=cls.auth_ref.auth_token, insecure=False, key_file=None, ca_file=None, cert_file=None, type_name="murano", type_version=1) else: artifacts_client = None artifacts_client=artifacts_client,

commit_message:
Refactor context roles attribute to base class

The Oslo context base class supports roles. Remove unnecessary
subclass definition. Also cleanup to_dict() to remove attributes already
specified by base class.

Change-Id: I966c5a5eb47a44ac05f04ede038529b4f420c91c

commit_message:
Proposal on supporting multiple Nova flavor

Currently Magnum can be used to provision a container cluster with one
Nova flavor for slave nodes and one flavor for master nodes. There are
some requirements that user want to provision a container cluster using
different Nova flavors for minion nodes.

Change-Id: I0f90758c4f5b33a204b0186ae2ff0fa032a4ca6d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/45/345745/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ================================== Create a Multiple-Nova-Flavor Bay ================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/magnum/+spec/support-multiple-flavor Currently Magnum can be used to provision a container cluster with one Nova flavor for slave nodes and one flavor for master nodes. There are some requirements that user want to provision a container cluster using different Nova flavors for minion nodes. Problem description =================== Magnum only supports one single flavor for all slave nodes in a bay. Although this works fine in the homogeneous deployment environment, Magnum deployment environment may have heterogeneous platforms, for instance, some are larger systems, some are smaller, some are UEFI systems and some are legacy systems. Furthermore, seen from the perspective of bay requirement, some slave nodes might require a bigger compute instance while others might just require smaller instances, some slave nodes might requires compute instances with GPU attached while others might requires RAID configuration. Current bay model does not provide flexibility to create a bay in such a heterogeneous environment. There is a user scenario that, there are 2 kind of baremetal machines in data center: some are legacy machines which do not support UEFI secure boot while others are new machines which support UEFI secure boot. User wants to provision a Magnum bay of Kubernetes from these 2 kind of machines and uses BIOS mode to boot legacy baremetal machines while UEFI secure boot mode to boot new machines. In this bay, user can create 2 Kubernetes labels (one is secure-boot and the other is non-secure-boot) and his data-sensitive workload can be scheduled on the slave nodes which are secure-booted. This requires that Magnum supports using multiple Nova flavors to provision slave nodes of a Magnum bay. Project Priority ---------------- Medium Proposed change =============== In order to support multiple Nova flavors, the following 2 places need to be changed. REST API in magnum and CLI in magnum_pythonclient There is no change for REST API and CLI to keep backward compatibility, but user needs to specify the "--labels" option of "magnum baymodel-create" to specify the map of the Nova flavors which user wants to add and the count of nodes while also specify the main flavor for the "--flavor-id" option. So the format of creating a Magnum baymodel is like: magnum baymodel-create --name <name> --flavor-id <default-flavor> --labels additional-flavors=<flavor-1>:<node-count-1>,<flavor-2>:<node-count-2>,... <flavor-N>:<node-count-N> ... magnum bay-create --name <bay-name> --baymodel <baymodel-name> --node-count <total-node-count> magnum bay-update --name <bay-name> replace node-count=<total-node-count> With the above baymodel and bay specified, magnum will create or updates a bay with <node-count-1> nodes with <flavor-1>, <node-count-2> nodes with <flavor-2>, ..., <node-count-N> nodes with <flavor-N> and (<total-node-count> - <node-count -1> - <node-count-2> - ... - <node-count-N>) nodes with <default-flavor>. if (<total-node-count> - <node-count-1> - <node-count-2> - ... - <node-count-N>) is less than 0, an error will occur when user executes "magnum bay-create" or "magnum bay-update". COE drivers in Magnum(in the case of Kubernetes) 2 new parameters are added to the <parameters> section in kubecluster.yaml and kubecluster-fedora-ironic.yaml: additional_flavor_map: type: json description: > a map of the index of additional flavors and their names. For example, '0': additional_flavor_0 '1': additional_flavor_1 '2': additional_flavor_2 additional_node_count_map: type: json description: > a map between the index of the counts of the nodes user want to provision and the count of the nodes. For example, '0': 1 '1': 1 '2': 1 The "kube_minions" resource group in the "resources" section in kubecluster.yaml and kubecluster-fedora-ironic.yaml are changed as follows: resource_def: type: kubecluster-flavor-ironic.yaml depends_on: - kube_master properties: additional_flavor_map: {get_param: minion_flavor_map} additional_flavor_index: '%index%' additional_node__count_map: {get_param: minion_flavor_count_map} ... And a new kubecluster-flavor-ironic.yaml for baremetal and kubecluster-flavor.yaml for vm and these 2 yaml file creates a resource group of which the resource type is "kubeminion-fedora-ironic.yaml" and "kubeminion.yaml" respectively. The content of the files are as follows: kube_minions: type: OS::Heat::ResourceGroup properties: count: {get_param: [additional_node_count_map, {get_param: additional_flavor_index}]} resource_def: type: kubeminion-fedora-ironic.yaml properties: minion_flavor: {get_param: [additional_flavor_map, {get_param: additional_flavor_index}]} ... Alternatives ------------ User can create multiple separated Magnum bays for multiple flavors respectively but this method brings about disadvantages, including but not limited to, being hard to transition pods or applications among different bays, having to monitor several Magnum bay status. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: duanlg (duanlg@live.cn) Other contributors: wan-yen-hsu (wan-yen.hsu@hp.com) fengbeihong (fengbeihong@gmail.com) Work Items ---------- 1. Modify or create Heat templates in Magnum 2. Parse parameters and feed them to Heat template Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit test and functional test for creating or update a baymodel and updating a bay change. Documentation Impact ==================== The user guide will be updated with details regarding creating a baymodel. References ========== [1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/magnum/+spec/support-multiple-flavor History ======= None

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-28 10:46:09.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/api/validation.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/commit/00f3824bca8c26e57b3eee8e64c3b30bbea10868', 'message': 'Enable to update master_count propertys of bay

master_count property of bay is not defined in the bay_update_allowed_properties
which is used at the time of validating bay properties in validate_bay_properties.
master_count parameter was added in the allowed set of property.

Change-Id: Id8557b4139df96c0c867e6f6e09bc6ae39b6fbd9
Closes-bug: #1580491
'}]
commit_message:
Enable to update master_count propertys of bay

master_count property of bay is not defined in the bay_update_allowed_properties
which is used at the time of validating bay properties in validate_bay_properties.
master_count parameter was added in the allowed set of property.

Change-Id: Id8557b4139df96c0c867e6f6e09bc6ae39b6fbd9
Closes-bug: #1580491
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/14/334914/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: bay_update_allowed_properties = set(['node_count', 'master_count'])

subject: Better namespace the list of TripleO actions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-19 08:48:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/c78373cbbf3d97892beadcef792bfe09b8e77431', 'message': 'Better namespace the list of TripleO actions

The action list is quite small, but growing rapidly and already

commit_message:
Better namespace the list of TripleO actions

The action list is quite small, but growing rapidly and already
getting confusing. In the Python package we have more detailed
namespaces to group the actions - we should use the same to group
them for users too.

This adds the new entry points, but leaves the existing names
in place. These can be removed once the CLI and GUI have
transitioned over.

Change-Id: I247747c7d641a70f320faf109c15745d00d62ff3

is what this is for.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-01 12:57:33.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/manifests/upgrade/pkg_upgrade.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/a02f3892a93705020b3f18b650f44bbd376b115f', 'message': 'Restore swift storage directory permissions after upgrade

Any update or reinstall glance-common package triggers
its postinst action with following command:
chown glance:glance -R /var/lib/glance/ /etc/glance/
We use /var/lib/glance/node by default as swift storage
folder http://goo.gl/97VJG2, and reinstallation of
glance-common breaks swift user access to it, so swift
services stop working. So, we need to fix /var/lib/glance/node

updated cluster is covered.
This workaround is applied on when swift is enabled.

Closes-bug: #1618553
Related-bug: #1619282

Change-Id: Iea6ce51d6ed9fe42bba1b26b58ba43268a7f880c

commit_message:
Restore swift storage directory permissions after upgrade

Any update or reinstall glance-common package triggers
its postinst action with following command:
chown glance:glance -R /var/lib/glance/ /etc/glance/
We use /var/lib/glance/node by default as swift storage
folder http://goo.gl/97VJG2, and reinstallation of
glance-common breaks swift user access to it, so swift
services stop working. So, we need to fix /var/lib/glance/node
folder permissions right after upgrade command.
Also, the case of adding new controller node for already
updated cluster is covered.
This workaround is applied on when swift is enabled.

Closes-bug: #1618553
Related-bug: #1619282

Change-Id: Iea6ce51d6ed9fe42bba1b26b58ba43268a7f880c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/88/364288/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if roles_include(['controller', 'primary-controller']) { $storage_hash = hiera_hash('storage', {}) if (!$storage_hash['images_ceph'] and !$storage_hash['objects_ceph'] and !$storage_hash['images_vcenter']) { # Glance package update changes permissions for /var/lib/glance and makes # it and its subdirectories owned by glance:glance (it executes in postinst stage). # We use /var/lib/glance/node as swift storage, and we need to allow # swift user to write into this directory. We should update all subdirectories # in /var/lib/glance/node to be owned by swift:swift. This should be applied right # after glance package update to decrease swift service downtime to minimum. # Swift services restart isn't required. $swift_partition = hiera('swift_partition', '/var/lib/glance/node') if $swift_partition =~ /\/var\/lib\/glance\// { # We can't use 'file' resource because we need to be sure that swift user and # group exist. They could be absent in case of adding new controller node # for already upgraded environment. exec { '/var/lib/glance/': command => 'chgrp swift /var/lib/glance/', onlyif => 'getent group swift && test -d /var/lib/glance/', path => ['/bin/', '/usr/bin/'], logoutput => 'on_failure', } -> exec { $swift_partition: command => "chown -R swift:swift ${swift_partition}", onlyif => "getent passwd swift && test -d ${swift_partition}", path => ['/bin/', '/usr/bin/'], logoutput => 'on_failure', } } } }

commit_message:
Change the way Murano dashboard collects static with UCA packages

Horizon UCA packages collects static during installation
and doesn't recollect it if we use '--clear' option. It leads
to static absesnce. So we need to delete '--clear' option for
Murano dashboard collectstatic script when we use UCA packages

Change-Id: I9719208dff88ce4f3be1b038b8bb6a49a6ec387f
Related-Bug: #1603528
(cherry picked from commit 5e6d5d3233c27e7912182d8ff71ea19f2ba5939e)

added_lines: let(:collect_static_command) { if facts[:os_package_type] == 'ubuntu' "/usr/share/openstack-dashboard/manage.py collectstatic --noinput" else "/usr/share/openstack-dashboard/manage.py collectstatic --noinput --clear" end } :command => collect_static_command let(:collect_static_command) { if facts[:os_package_type] == 'ubuntu' "/bin/openstack-dashboard/manage.py collectstatic --noinput" else "/bin/openstack-dashboard/manage.py collectstatic --noinput --clear" end } :command => collect_static_command

commit_message:
Include both Trusty and Xenial gate-requirements-integration-dsvm

With the merge of Ia139c66e4e1daadae107b2fcdd0768d8d36bc984 we switched
to gating on ubuntu-xenial rather than ubuntu-trusty.  This uncovered a
small issue with the requirements gate and a larger issue for how we
correctly generate constraints during the transition from python3.4 to
python3.5.

This review adds back gate-requirements-integration-dsvm-ubuntu-trusty
so we can verify that we *can* correctly generate constraints for python
3.4 and python 3.5

Change-Id: I33e44578121c771e41d7068f9f020ecb87a9949f
Depends-On: I6acabf86933b7a7bce7baf44e6b512e7d0d2f6db
Related-Bug: 1620436

commit_message:
Add docs for docker registry

This patch adds doc for usage of docker registry v2.0 in Magnum.

Change-Id: I1df4a19fda25505d3fbd41eca9e3a78db067819c
Partially-Implements: blueprint registryv2-in-master
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/30/259930/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ========================= Using Docker Registry 2.0 ========================= Docker Registry 2.0 is a stateless, highly scalable server side application that stores and lets you distribute Docker images. You should use the Registry if you want to: 1.tightly control where your images are being stored 2.fully own your images distribution pipeline 3.integrate image storage and distribution tightly into your in-house development workflow How docker registry is deployed =============================== Docker registry is deployed on every minion in k8s coe(support for other coes will be added later). It runs in docker and listens to localhost:5000. Docker registry now stores images in Swift. As docker registry support many storage backends, we can add support for them later. How to use docker registry ========================== As docker registry stores images in Swift now, you need to enable Swift when you run devstack. cat >> /opt/stac/devstack/local.conf << EOF enable_service s-proxy enbale_service s-object enable_service s-container enable_service s-account EOF If you want to use docker registry in your bay, you need to enable docker registry when you create the baymodel. magnum baymodel-create --name k8sbaymodel \ --image-id fedora-21-atomic-5 \ --keypair-id testkey \ --external-network-id public \ --dns-nameserver 8.8.8.8 \ --flavor-id m1.small \ --docker-volume-size 5 \ --network-driver flannel \ --coe kubernetes --registry-enabled If you want to upload a image to docker registry, you need to login into a minion and use 'docker push' to upload the image to docker registry. docker tag image_name localhost:5000/image_name docker push localhost:5000/image_name Finally, you can use the image with reference localhost:5000/image_name in your manifest file.

Filter raw_report only with log events for noop_run

Use filter for raw_report only with log events (such as what was
changed, were was changed, what was triggered and etc) for noop_run.

Related-bug: #1618945
